Importing data¶

MODULO accepts numpy.array data matrices only. If you do not have it already, ReadData is here to help: specifying where your files are stored and other details it takes care of converting your single files into a processable matrix.

class read_db.ReadData[source]¶

A MODULO helper class for input data. ReadData allows to load the data directly before using MODULO, and hence assemblying the data matrix D from data, if needed.

Currently, it supports .dat, .csv and .txt files.

read_db.ReadData._from_dat(folder, filename, N, N_S, h: int = 0, f: int = 0, c: int = 0)¶

This method imports data (in the specified format) and then assemblies the corresponding data matrix, D.

Parameters:
  • folder – str Folder in which the data is stored
  • filename – str Name of the files to be imported
  • number of components (N) – int Components to be analysed
  • h – int Lines to be skipped from header
  • f – int Lines to be skipped from footer
  • c – int Columns to be skipped
Returns:

np.array Assembled DataMarix

This method imports data (in the specified format) and then assemblies the corresponding data matrix, D.
